SENT.plain: An adult greyhound was evaluated on three occasions for acute, intracranial neurologic signs
Based on magnetic resonance (MR) imaging, there were T2-hyperintense and T1-hypointense, noncontrast enhancing lesions in the cerebellum, and brain stem
Using diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI), the lesions were characterized initially by restricted water diffusion
The presumptive diagnosis on each occasion was acute ischemic cerebrovascular accident leading to infarction

This allowed us to characterize the changes in appearance of infarcted neural tissue on the standard MR sequences over time, and to confirm that the DWI could be successfully used in low-field imaging. Â© 2012 Veterinary Radiology & Ultrasound
